metadata.Title: CVE-2021-40516 on Ubuntu 23.04 (lunar) - medium.
metadata.Description:
WeeChat before 3.2.1 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (crash) via a crafted WebSocket frame that trigger an out-of-bounds read in plugins/relay/relay-websocket.c in the Relay plugin.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-40516` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

weechat - 3.2.1-1
weechat-core - 3.2.1-1
weechat-curses - 3.2.1-1
weechat-guile - 3.2.1-1
weechat-headless - 3.2.1-1
weechat-lua - 3.2.1-1
weechat-perl - 3.2.1-1
weechat-php - 3.2.1-1
weechat-plugins - 3.2.1-1
weechat-python - 3.2.1-1
weechat-ruby - 3.2.1-1
weechat-tcl - 3.2.1-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: weechat package in lunar, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.2.1-1').
